snippet: During an appearance in federal court in Alexandria, Va., Eric G. Harroun was denied release to home detention in Arizona.
abstract: Federal Judge Ivan D Davis declines to release Eric G Harroun, former US Army private charged with fighting alongside Al Nusra Front, terrorist group that is battling the Syrian government of Pres Bashar al-Assad, to home detention; case underscores awkward position of United States in Syrian conflict.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and REBEKAH ZEMANSKY
byline.contributor: Scott Shane reported from Alexandria, and Rebekah Zemansky from Phoenix.

lead_paragraph: During an appearance in federal court in Alexandria, Va., Eric G. Harroun was denied release to home detention in Arizona.

headline.seo: Eric Harroun, Who Fought With Syrian Rebels, Loses a Court Fight
headline.main: Judge Rules Against Veteran Who Fought Alongside Syrian Rebels
headline.print_headline: Judge Rules Against Veteran Who Fought Alongside Syrian Rebels
